content.question: A cart with a toy projectile launcher attached to its top travels forward at a constant speed <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. The launcher fires a solid sphere forward at a speed much greater than that of the cart-launcher system. The cart’s speed after firing the dart is <math alttext="v sub f is less than v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo><</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Frictional forces are considered to be negligible. Which of the following scenarios best represents the rotational analog to this situation?

choices.label: A gaseous planet rotates with a large rotational velocity, causing the middle of the planet's equator to bulge outward.
A spinning platform falls onto a stationary platform. Both platforms rotate together, but at a smaller common rotational speed than that of the spinning platform immediately before the collision.
A child on the edge of a large rotating disk throws a ball in the same direction as the child’s tangential velocity.
A figure skater spins with the skater’s hands at the skater’s waist. When the skater extends the skater’s arms outward, the skater’s rotational velocity decreases.

content.answer: A child on the edge of a large rotating disk throws a ball in the same direction as the child’s tangential velocity.
